name: Hearts of Palm Aguachile
description: Aguachile is traditional Mexican dish, similar to ceviche, served on the coast of Mexico. It is usually made with shrimp. I've substituted hearts of palm here.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups Sliced cucumber (peeled and without seeds)

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the water from the hearts of palm can. Slice them in half lengthwise and slice them ¼ inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the water from the hearts of palm can. Slice them in half lengthwise and slice them ¼ inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the cucumber, cut lengthwise, and use a spoon to scoop out the seeds. Do not discard the seeds and flesh.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel the cucumber, cut lengthwise, and use a spoon to scoop out the seeds. Do not discard the seeds and flesh.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl combine the hearts of palm, 1 cup of the sliced cucumber, and the sliced red onion.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl combine the hearts of palm, 1 cup of the sliced cucumber, and the sliced red onion.

recipeInstructions.text: In the blender, combine the serrano pepper, lime juice, chopped cilantro, the additional 1 cup of sliced cucumber, the seeds and flesh that was scooped out of the cucumbers, and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In the blender, combine the serrano pepper, lime juice, chopped cilantro, the additional 1 cup of sliced cucumber, the seeds and flesh that was scooped out of the cucumbers, and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour this liquid over the hearts of palm mixture, season with salt and pepper, and let sit in refrigeration for 10 min.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour this liquid over the hearts of palm mixture, season with salt and pepper, and let sit in refrigeration for 10 min.

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust seasoning and serve on crispy tostadas with sliced of avocado.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust seasoning and serve on crispy tostadas with sliced of avocado.
